Blood of Confucius
This character is a patrilineal descendant of Confucius (Kong Qiu), who was a renowned Chinese philosopher during the Spring and Autumn Period.
Imperial Blood of Emperor Gaozu
The Sakanoue clan's ancestry can be traced all the way back to the heavenly Empeor Gaozu, who founded the glorious Han Dynasty.
Blood of Wu Zetian
The only monarch of the short-lived Zhou dynasty, Wu Zetian has the distinction of being the only woman to sit on the Dragon Throne.
Blood of Dongmyeongseongwang
Dongmyeongseongwang, the "Holy King of the East", was the founder of the state of Goguryeo, and the ancestor of both its rulers and the rulers of Baekje.
Blood of Baekje
The kingdom of Baekje was instrumental in spreading continental culture and Buddhism to Japan.
Blood of Goguryeo
The kingdom of Goguryeo had several skilled warrior kings, even though it eventually fell to an alliance between Silla and Tang.
Blood of Suro
Gim Suro was the founder of Geumgwan Gaya, the ruling city-state of the Gaya Confederacy, and the founder of a dynasty relevant well after his death.
Blood of the Bak clan
The Bak clan was the first clan to rule in Silla, starting with the kingdom's founding ruler, Hyeokgeose.
Blood of the Suk clan
The Suk clan was the second clan to rule in Silla, starting with the kingdom's fourth ruler, Talhae.
Blood of the Gim clan
The Gim clan was the third clan to rule in Silla, and could trace their ancestry back to Suro of Geumgwan Gaya.
Blood of Balhae
The Kingdom of Balhae was multi-cultural and multi-religious, but its rulers promoted the Buddhist religion.
Blood of Taejo
Wang Taejo of Goryeo reunited the Korean Peninsula at the end of the Later Three Kingdoms period and is rightfully regarded as an exemplary Korean monarch.
Blood of Yi Uibang
Yi Uibang overthrew Uijong of Goryeo and installed Myeongjong as a puppet ruler, wielding considerable power behind the throne.
Blood of Jeong Jungbu
Jeong Jungbu quarrelled with Yi Uibang and took over as the power behind the throne in Goryeo after his son murdered the latter.
Blood of Gyeong Daeseung
Having successfully rebelled against Jeong Jungbu, Gyeong Daeseung took over as the power behind the throne in Goryeo.
Blood of Yi Uimin
Yi Uimin was born a slave but eventually became the power behind the throne in Goryeo after the death of Gyeong Daeseung.
Blood of Choe Chungheon
Having murdered Yi Uimin, Choe Chungheon took over as the power behind the throne in Goryeo.
Blood of Gim Jun
Having overthrown and killed Choe Ui, Gim Jun took over as the power behind the throne in Goryeo.
Blood of Im Yeon
Having killed his adoptive father Gim Jun, Im Yeon took over as the power behind the throne in Goryeo.
Blood of Hong Dagu
Hong Jungi, better known as Hong Dagu, was a Korean in the service of the Yuan dynasty who came to rule the Liaoyang Province.
Blood of Choe Tan
Choe Tan invaded and took over the Dongnyeong Prefectures in the name of the Yuan dynasty and became the local ruler as a result.
Blood of Jo Hwi
Jo Hwi invaded the Ssangseong Prefectures in the service of the Mongol Empire and became the local ruler as a result.
Blood of Tenno Jimmu
The Chrysanthemum Throne has always been held by a patrilineal descendant of Tenno Jimmu.
Blood of the Fujiwara Clan
The Fujiwara clan was the power behind the throne in Japan for many years, serving as the regent for the Tenno.
Blood of Hachimantaro
[This.GetBestName] was a paragon of samurai skill and bravery, and his descendants might benefit from this reputation
Blood of the Oshu Fujiwara
The Oshu Fujiwara ruled the Tohoku region independently following the fall of the Kiyohara clan.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
[This.GetBestName] was the first samurai to be appointed to the position of Daijo Daijni, which gave him considerable influence.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
[This.GetBestName] founded the Kamakura Shogunate after the end of the Genpei War.
Blood of the Hojo clan
Hojo Tokimasa became Shikken when Minamoto no Yoriie inherited the Kamakura Shogunate, and thus the de facto ruler.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
[This.GetBestName] founded the [This.GetOnlyDynastyName] Shogunate after helping overthrow the Kamakura Shogunate.
Blood of the Wanyan clan
The half-legendary Hanpu Wanyan might have been from Goryeo. No matter his origins, he began the work to consolidate the Jurchen tribes.
Blood of the Srivijayas
The Srivijaya dynasty ruled a thalassocratic empire in the Indonesian archipelago, subjugating many of their neighbours and promoting Buddhism.
Blood of the Sailendra
The Sailendra dynasty ruled a thalassocratic empire in the Indonesian archipelago, subjugating many of their neighbours and promoting Buddhism.
Blood of Alexander the Great
Though all but impossible to prove, there is some benefit to claiming descent from Alexander the Great
Blood of Anawrahta
Anawrahta the Great founded the Empire of Bagan, assisted by the warriors known as the Four Great Paladins.
Blood of Suryavarman II
Suryavarman II is known for the construction of Angkor Wat, among other things.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
Using various means, [This.GetBestName] managed to become Grand Chancellor and the real power behind the throne.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
Having overthrown [This.GetHerHis] former liege, [This.GetBestName] became the real power behind the throne as Grand Chancellor.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
Having saved [This.GetHerHis] liege from the machinations of the court, [This.GetBestName] became the real power behind the throne as Grand Chancellor.
Blood of [This.GetTitledFirstName]
[This.GetTitledFirstName] managed to reunite the Korean Peninsula. [This.GetSheHeCap] and [This.GetHerHis] heirs will therefore have a lasting claim on it.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
[This.GetBestName] served as a Permanent Regent, and some say [This.GetSheHe] was the de facto ruler.
Blood of a Shogun
[This.GetBestName] served as the Shogun for the Tenno, and some say [This.GetSheHe] was the de facto ruler.
Blood of the Kiyohara clan
With the Imperial Court uninterested in Tohoku, the Kiyohara clan came to rule the region independently.
Dragonslayer Blood of [This.GetTitledFirstName]
[This.GetBestName] will forever be remembered as the one who killed dreaded Fredak, the Emperor of Embers.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
[This.GetBestName] rose from being a modest commander assigned to the Treasure Fleet to being the ruler of an empire rivaling the Middle Kingdom itself.
Blood of [This.GetBestName]
[This.GetBestName] refounded the Hwarang after the Later Three Kingdoms period in Korea, a most impressive achievement.
Champion Blood of [This.GetTitledFirstName]
[This.GetTitledFirstName] successfully proved that [This.GetSheHe] was not only the best Warrior of the Rising Sun, but also a true champion.
Divine Blood of [This.GetBestName]
The blood of the Aesir and the Vanir flows through the veins of [This.GetBestName] and [This.GetHerHis] descendants.
Divine Blood of [This.GetBestName]
It is a truth unversally acknowledged that [This.GetBestName] can find one or more divinities far, far back in [This.GetHerHis] family tree.
